name: TheAtlantic
text: "Immigration into the United States allows multicultural interactions that produce Americans who can see the country from both within and without," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/ZNaE1YrxHw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Catherine O’Hara, who plays the bombastic matriarch in "Schitt’s Creek," has won this year’s Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series.

In 2019, @aawicks wrote about the character’s aspirational fabulousness. https://t.co/AzCsNdqHkI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There is no such thing as a singular Latino electorate. There are only Latino electorates, which vary by state, gender, generation, economic status, and their family's nation of origin," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/bHYrkyJjZy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This advice may sound strange, but anyone who cares about the future of the Supreme Court needs to speak as little as possible about the Supreme Court," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/WgWGxhNFKr

name: TheAtlantic
text: The actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, who won an Emmy tonight for his performance in “Watchmen,” discussed the show's reimagining of his character as a Black man in a 2019 interview with @shirklesxp. https://t.co/H2ZfcZcj1f

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Requiring religious people in the ordinary course of their lives to follow the rules that apply to everyone else is not hostility; it is equality," Howard Gillman and Erwin Chemerinsky write: https://t.co/RnTRigN2b2

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As many New Yorkers have discovered since the start of the pandemic, our mayor has not demonstrated the ability to manage large-scale operations or the energy to get things done," @gracerauh writes: https://t.co/dIO60ifRLm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Zendaya, who stars in HBO's "Euphoria," has become the youngest to win the Emmy for lead actress in a drama.

In 2019, @sophiegg wrote about her "ability to quickly shift modes, communicating both Rue’s cynical, hardened edges … and her vulnerability.”https://t.co/V6b5XuLofj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Succession," HBO’s satirical dramedy about a Murdochesque media empire, won this year’s Emmy for best drama series. In 2019, @megangarber analyzed the show’s “gross physicality.” https://t.co/veQa1ToNYW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Then all at once my being like this in my brain, this sense of being my brain became unbearable to me." "Brain," a poem by C. K. Williams, published in The Atlantic in 2010: https://t.co/YkzT9z6aIe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The world starts to see you as a product...and that's a hard thing to deal with when you're a human." For The Friendship Files, @julieebeck spoke with Veronica Roth and @mstohl, authors of the "Divergent" and "Beautiful Creatures," about mental health: https://t.co/OkMD4mDQe4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reports of a vote-by-mail apocalypse are greatly exaggerated: The nation's postal unions are considerably more confident USPS is ready for the election, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/eveaY1su8s

name: TheAtlantic
text: Anthony Fauci tells The Atlantic that a coronavirus vaccine will not likely be in widespread distribution "until well into 2021." @jameshamblin reports on what that means for the winter: https://t.co/po3toOc95a

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books about U.S. history, mass incarceration, urban life, and more offer a look at the profound fractures within America and what it might take to mend them, in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @cray_kate: https://t.co/vfhQVmr98f

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coming battle over Ruth Bader Ginsburg's Supreme Court seat is arguably the last thing the United States needs right now, writes @russellberman: https://t.co/LN9gqD6xaf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: NEW: Have you wondered how and why Robert Mueller's investigation failed to hold the president accountable? George Packer has the first read of Mueller deputy Andrew Weissmann's book—and an interview with Weissmann to go with it. Read at @TheAtlantic: https://t.co/1icUix86N6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Trump’s pardon power was an obstacle that the prosecutors didn’t anticipate and could never overcome. It kept them from being able to push uncooperative targets as hard as in an ordinary criminal case.” https://t.co/mmGG4KbhhR

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who worries about how her children will react if she confesses to her affair. https://t.co/RDnsofQgoU

name: TheAtlantic
text: We're LIVE at #TheAtlanticFest! Tune in to our first event, The Big Story: Election 2020, streaming here: https://t.co/vYlS44dB7r.

name: TheAtlantic
text: Happening now: @RonBrownstein, Senior Editor @TheAtlantic, joined by @emmaogreen, @AdamHSays, @PeterAtlantic. To join the discussion tweet us using the event hashtag #TheAtlanticFest https://t.co/vYlS44dB7r
